definition: to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate

sentences.english: The growth of our business ties has slowed down in recent years, showing a lack of sustained momentum.
sentences.chinese: 中日经贸关系近年来发展势头趋缓，后续动力不足。

sentences.english: His over-excited emotions gradually calmed down after taking the sedative.
sentences.chinese: 服用过镇静剂以后，他过于激动的情绪逐渐趋缓。

sentences.english: The velocity of increase of inbound tourism beyond expectation, and the domestic tourism increased slowly.
sentences.chinese: 入境旅游增长速度超乎预期，而国内旅游增长趋缓。

sentences.english: The post-cold-war world situation shows a relaxed tendency, and peace and development have become the mainstream of the international affairs.
sentences.chinese: 冷战结束后世界形势趋缓，和平与发展成为世界主流。

definition: to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
(of trains) down (i.e. away from the capital)/(of river boats) to travel downstream/to issue (a document) to lower bureaucratic levels/(of writing on the page) vertical, proceeding from top to bottom
(of trains) up (i.e. towards the capital)/(of river boats) to go against the current/to submit (a document) to higher authorities
to wither/to dry up (of a plant)/to atrophy (of muscle, social custom etc)
